storyInfo: Despite her colleagues' opposition, Mounted Officer Grani investigates the arson at the pub. As the suspects flee, they inadvertently set off an explosion.

attributes.content: November 19th, 1097, 7:44 A.M.
And you don't remember when someone first opened it up?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Has to have been two months ago, at least.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: But we always sealed this part off with planks. A few naughty kids pulled them off to climb in a while back, so it might just be the same story this time.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Have you seen anyone go in or out?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No, it's dark as night down here. Why would anyone?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Alright... got it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *Sigh* This still isn't making sense... and it's so suspicious. I've already found six abandoned structures up till now where the entryway's started being used again.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Plenty of witnesses are testifying about dragging sounds from the underground channels at evening, too. The atmosphere around the Infected community just doesn't sit right. It feels like someone's fiddling about.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Not one person's got a reason to be using these entrances again...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: (Claps face)
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Forget it, enough of that for now. Both the littlest things and the big stuff the town's survival hinges on are just as important, yep!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Let's see what else there is... Oh, yeah... the burglary case at Count Bishmer's.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Where do I start investigating that?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Who would it be? Slipping past a noble house's strict defenses and stealing something isn't your standard thief's fare.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: According to the Count's servants, the burglar pops in and out all over the Infected neighborhood. So, they're either extra familiar with the terrain there, or have special Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: —Of course, that's assuming the servants aren't lying to avoid responsibility.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: ...Hmm, I don't think they would though. I've heard a lot of similar reports the last two weeks. All signs say there really is some thief on the run in Caladon City.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: A very strange thief, special Originium Arts...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Whatever, let's drop by the Infected community and see.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Grani, finally found you!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Mrs. Sunny? Calm down, calm down, what's the matter?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: My little Pom's run away! I've been looking for two hours already, help me find him! He usually listens so well, he's never run off before, what if someone bad finds him...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: No worries, Missus, I'll help you look right away!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Thank you, thank you!
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Did anything happen right before Pom ran away? Have you asked anyone nearby? ...Ah, don't rush, Missus, take it slow...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: An hour later.
Over here, Mrs. Sunny, I've found Pom!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Oh...! Let me take a look. Phew, that's a relief... he's still alright. I'm so sorry to trouble you, Grani, I know you're so busy with work, and here I am making you search for a pet of all things.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. If Pom really did vanish, you'd be torn to pieces! I wouldn't call that nothing!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But, I heard John next door saying you aren't getting along too well with the Guards, and they even got on your case a few days ago for something or other...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Hahaha... it was nothing.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But if you're going to raise a fowlbeast, Mrs. Sunny, I'd recommend keeping him in a cage... Things would get hairy if he bit anyone.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Oh, you've got a point.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Speaking of, Missus, have you seen any strangers about the Infected community lately?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Strangers? Plenty of the people here come from other cities—strangers aren't the strangest thing.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: I mean the sort that... um... might have uncanny Originium Arts, that sort of Infected?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: You know how the power went out in the neighborhood last month.
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Oh! Yep, the case of some bad actor wrecking the community's generators, right? But we've never found the culprit...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I did hear the supply got restored in no time, though. Did someone fix all the generators up?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Right! I heard they got this incredible engineering Caster in, and in a few hours, they already had the generators repaired! Question is, when did the community ever have an engineer so great?
attributes.name: Infected Citizen

attributes.content: Right... something's definitely odd about that...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: November 20th, 1097, 6:44 P.M.
Here's my work report for today. If you could give it a look over, guv'nor.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hm. Two robberies, an inquiry report on rumors in Caladon... You must be pulling my leg.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: What about the burglary at Count Bishmer's?! How long do you think it's been? Get on it!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Um—isn't that one only a day old...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Is a day not enough?!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I broke my back getting you as a temporary transfer. The Mounted Police were singing your praises as an investigator. And for what? A day's worth of time isn't enough for you? For one tiny case of property theft?!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: (Under her breath) It was the City Council who borrowed me from the Mounted Police...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Enough! You don't know respect, you talk back to your senior! Is this how the Mounted Police behave?!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: I'm sorry, guv'nor!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'Investigated entranceways of abandoned structures. Turned out to be as suspicious as thought, inquired with surrounding residents...' What the hell is this?! Weren't you told you could leave this be?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Caladon City gets strange business day in, day out, and wherever else the bloody day feels like! If every one of the Guards was as suspicious as you, we'd all be dead from the stress!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: But, guv'nor, if we let this all lie, then there's a real chance...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Stop with the rubbish, get out and investigate!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Yes, guv'nor!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: November 22nd, 1097, 10:20 A.M.
*Pant*...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Li'l~ Susie~
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Let me give your ears a good rubbie-rub!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hahaha! What's the matter, Officer Grani?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Something at work, I imagine.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Nothing much, just some hiccups lately with my job.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Go on, what exactly's happening?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It's not that big, to be honest...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You've all heard the recent rumors in the city, I'm guessing.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Ah, you mean those urban legends in the paper?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Same as ever, I assume. 'Sounds can be heard from the city underground,' 'criminals have infiltrated the Infected community,' and so on.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Right... I was wanting to investigate those. I wrote up a dedicated report over the past few days.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But the Guards don't care about any of it! They want me to keep my nose out of things!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Eh? Do the Mounted Police investigate urban legends, too?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Come on, that's the wrong idea, Susie!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: My work experience taught me that when these rumors crop up in a city, usually they come from the criminal activity that hides behind it.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Like the 'sounds from underground' one.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Did you know? There's massive runs of logistics channels lying abandoned under Caladon.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Right. In the earlier years, back when the nomadic sectors were being planned, they drafted plenty of channels through the structural layers. But following the city's development, a lot of the old plates' underground ways were too taxing to maintain, so they relinquished them all.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Yep. For example, plenty of them run under the Infected community.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you get it now? If those rumors are true, then that means there are people doing something at evening in those empty logistics channels, out of sight.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Er... this is a bit scary, isn't it?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's too bad I still don't have any direct proof.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I think you can worry yourself a little less about it. It's meant to be the Guards' job, after all.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: If something does happen later, they're the layabouts. You've got nothing to fear.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Well, if you put it that way...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: *Sigh* It's patrol hours right now, so I guess I'm a layabout myself, sitting here...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hahaha... we won't tell anyone.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Li'l~ Susie~
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Let me give your ears a good rubbie-rub!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Go ahead, but careful of the static, okay?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: November 24th, 1097, 6:15 P.M.
In front of the shambles of the 'Green Spark' stands a thunderstruck Officer Grani.
Before her eyes was that shop full of human warmth—now, with its roof collapsed, walls crumbled, and nothing left but charred black wreckage.
She stares blankly at the ruins in front of her, not daring to believe her eyes.
...But why?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Wh... why? Why would...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Oh, Miss Grani, you're here now?
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: Wh-What happened here? Why is this place...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Too much for me to swallow, too. It could only be out of revenge, setting a place like this alight.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: Setting?! Someone set this place on fire?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: What about the owner here? Where's that Feline girl? Have you seen her?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No, we haven't, but no one was in there last night when the fire went up.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: We're lucky no one's burnt, or worse.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: Who the hell did this?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Anger.
She clenches her fists tight.
The pub she visits practically every week, the adorable owner lady, the diverting guests... A moment of rare respite in this city, now turned to charred rubble.
The anger flooding Grani's mind is hard to keep in check—rarely is she ever this enraged.
She's reached the point of wanting to bring justice to the culprit herself, no matter who it is.
Hey! No going in! We still haven't cleaned up the debris yet!
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: That's fine, I'm looking over the scene of the crime. I might find something in this.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Don't bother, officer.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: The Guards came over this morning. They looked all around, called it an accident, and left just like that.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: An accident? But didn't you just say...?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: That's just my opinion as a firefighter. We see a lot of things wherever we're called, and this we've seen.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: What's this... a scrap of explosive?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Yeah, but the Guards had us keep out of this, so I didn't say much.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: And nobody cares, really... about the Infected community. It's all less said, the better.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: Can you pass this evidence on to me?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Sure, it was burning my hand, anyway. Didn't think I should hold it... and you're with the Guards, at any rate.
attributes.name: Fire Brigade Member

attributes.content: Let me see...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Wait, hold on... these are shards from a military-grade incendiary! I've seen this sort back in Mounted Police training.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Is it just me, or... are these shards familiar?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: November 26th, 1097, 7:15 A.M.
So we meet again, Mr. Maud?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Th... The Mount?!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Did they just let you go? I thought they'd keep you in custody for longer than this.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Don't take me in again, officer, I'm begging you! All I am's a handyman!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: I haven't bothered about with those Infected in recent, I swear!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Are you sure?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you still remember that incendiary we confiscated from your loot, a few days ago when I arrested you?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You said you'd only bought one for 'self-defense'.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: But military-grade bomb shells have a very obvious unique design. They're not hard to identify even when shattered. Can you guess where I found this little piece?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: If you're lying, it's another trip with me back to the Guards.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: No! I'll tell you! Anything you want!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: I bought a case, I confess it! I bought a case! But I sold it all on to other people!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: The Danton brothers! I sold it to the Danton brothers!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: The Danton brothers? Who are they?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Those two Siracusan immigrants! The two mafia henchmen! Go ask the people at the Boil! They know 'em!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Then do you know why they'd want to burn down an Infected community pub?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I don't know! I swear, no idea! I didn't hear a thing about the pub!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: I got the firebombs from the—the black market at the Boil, too! I swear, that's the honest truth!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: But the merchant there said, he's got ways of getting goods done directly at the factory...
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: (Factories in Caladon... I think there's only Count Bishmer's manufacturing military supplies...)
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you know where the Danton brothers are?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I... I'm not 100%, I just know they always hang around in the Boil...
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: The Boil, huh...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: November 27th, 1097, 6:15 P.M.
How many times have I had to tell you? Have you caught the burglar?! Have you finished your patrols?! Only you Mounted Police sideshow jugglers would obsess over the tiniest meaningless business.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: You call this meaningless business?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Is it not?! Is a single Infected community pub burning down worth you spending three days to investigate?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: A short-circuit in the mains, offended a gang, a lightning strike! I can think of a hundred other reasons still. Once you finally discover there was no culprit at all, who takes responsibility for all the cases this has held up? You?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: So what about this evidence? These military incendiaries were made at Councilor Bishmer's factory, and were meant as supplies for the Victorian Army! But they circulated into the black market!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Doesn't this warrant investigating that factory?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: That's Count Bishmer's estate! You're saying you'll sweep a Member of the Council's factory?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: You've got some brass!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Military incendiaries! The underground black market! The evidence is all in front of you! Why are you still playing the idiot here?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Don't tell me, you get a piece of these black market deals too?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You...! Do you know what you're saying? You dare tell me this to my face?!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Who do you think you're fooling? Count Bishmer's your own relative, isn't he?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You... you!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: How did someone like you get into the position of Captain of the Guards?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: You don't have a care in you for Infected community cases, and you turn a blind eye when gangs from the Boil cause disaster. And now you're not going to look into something this massive?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Then what IS your job? You've abandoned your duties!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Is there still anyone in the Caladon Guards qualified to enforce the law?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: So you're going to mutiny?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: I'm a Mounted Police Officer on temporary transfer here by the City Council! Right now, I'm the one in charge of the Mounted Police of Caladon City—you and I are of the same rank! You should have no authority to order me!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Fine, then! I just knew you bumpkin lot would...
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: You wait. You just wait until the Duke's back from Londinium. I'll report to him in full detail just the kind of attitude you 'Mounted Police' bring to your work!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Suit yourself! Goodbye!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Lowly circus spectacles, damned backwater blood... You wait until the Duke's back! You'll get your damn dues!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 7:15 P.M.
White House Pub, The Boil, Caladon
What are they doin'? That sets us back a whole day!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: You think it's some kinda slip-up at the factory?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Then what do we do now?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: We hold on a little longer... If we still don't get news by this evening, we dip out, pronto.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Is there anything I can do for you?
attributes.name: Barman

attributes.content: Evening, I'm looking for two people they call 'the Danton Brothers' and I've heard some say they see them come by this pub sometimes...
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Shit! What got the Guards in here?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Don't panic! We're in the Boil, what's she gonna try?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Ha! Found you!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: So, what does, ah... a fine Mounted Police Officer want with a pair of law-abiding brothers?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: I'll need you to come with me to the Guards about a case of arson in the Infected neighborhood, early morning on the 24th. I have a few questions I'd like to ask.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And if we politely decline?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Please, comply with law enforcement's work, Mr. Danton.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Easy there, Mount! This is the Boil you're in. Your word isn't law here.
attributes.name: Barman

attributes.content: Get out. You're not welcome at my bar.
attributes.name: Barman

attributes.content: In an instant, the atmosphere in the pub begins to strain. A few bruisers with vicious looks rise from their seats.
They pull out weapons, eyeing the pint-sized officer with malice.
Hahaha, this is Caladon's Boil, signora. You fancy coppers don't fit in here.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Go on back to helping the Infected scrub their chamber pots. That sounds about right for you.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: (Nine people... I've got plenty to write once the report comes...)
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 7:50 P.M.
Streets of Caladon
Motor it! Quick, she's right behind us!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: My hand's broken!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Suck it up and keep runnin'! This Mount's crazy!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: We can't beat that shit! Are they all like her?!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Save it! Go for the Infected ghetto, the layout's all screwy there, we still got a chance!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Did we shake her?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Shut up, keep it down!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: She didn't see us. We hide here, we're gold.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Son of a bitch, something's wrong with this Mount. How the hell did she even find us?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: You save your breath.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Who are... you?
attributes.name: Little

attributes.content: Huh?!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Where'd the brat come from?!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: This is Miss Witch's house. What are you doing in here?
attributes.name: Little

attributes.content: Shut her up! The Mount's right outside!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Stupid little punk, I oughta...
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: I get it! You're bad people!
attributes.name: Little

attributes.content: The immature witch extends her right hand, and a purple thunderbolt leaps from it.
(Shoot, where'd they run?)
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hello... can I ask if you've seen—
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Just as the Kuranta officer starts talking to a nearby resident, two men dressed in black fly out from the window of a building not far away, hitting a wall with two heavy thuds.
Hot-hot-hot! Little shit!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Cavolo, stupid Infected, I'm gonna get her...
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Great! So this is where you two holed up.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Shit! Cheese it!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Where the hell to?!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: The abandoned section! There's a safehouse there!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 8:59 P.M.
Disused border sector of Caladon
The two black-suits huff and gasp as they run through the deserted streets.
And the pint-sized Kuranta officer is hot on their tails.
I think we lost her.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: My ass we lost her! You think you can lose a Kuranta officer in the city? Keep running!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: How much farther?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Almost there! Right up front.
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Made it. In here.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Our contact was here? This safehouse is shot to hell!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Save it. They said they'd ready up any clothes and fake IDs for skipping town, put 'em here. There's a hidden passage through the old logistics channels. We'll find a way to slip out.
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Hiding in a building, huh. Not planning to give up?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Don't test my patience, alright? We're on the edge of the city. You can't fall back any further now.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: And let me remind you two, hiding in that building to ambush me isn't going to do anything for you, okay?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Keep resisting, and you'll only keep piling on the charges against you.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Put down the crossbows and bombs, and surrender this instant.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: What the hell, where is everybody? The lights are dead?!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: This room's a goddamned mess! What's all that piled on the ground? I can't even tell.
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: You just knocked something over! What the hell's that smell?!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: It's too dark! I can't see anything!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Why'd they pile up all this crap? They tryin' to pull something?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: This stinks to high heaven! Where's our contact?!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: I don't like this! This building ain't right!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: If you still won't come out, I'll have to break in by force.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: About time you witnessed a Mounted Officer's true strength.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The pint-sized officer reverse grips her pike and lowers her body. She lifts it over her head, Originium Arts coalescing at its tip, the pike wholly bathed in a dark red luster in the black of the night.
I haven't used this maneuver in a long, long time. Don't blame me if anyone gets hurt, alright?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do something! She's gonna break down the door!
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Don't panic! Calm down!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Flashlight! You got it or not?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: What kind of mook carries a goddamned flashlight around?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: The firebombs! You had one left, right?
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: You gonna burn the place down?
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: Dumbass! You throw the bomb in there first, we escape before the fire spreads! The house goes up, and that beat cop ain't gonna follow us! Two fowls, one stone!
attributes.name: Sly Black-Suit

attributes.content: Makes sense! Let me see...
attributes.name: Imposing Black-Suit

attributes.content: The imposing black-suit pulls the ring on an incendiary meant for military use, and tosses it into the depths of the pitch-black room.
However—
The moment the flare lights up is the moment they finally realize just how stupid a decision they've made.
Within the cramped, dilapidated room sits a great pile of Originium explosives and hazardous chemicals.
The bucket they knocked over earlier was filled with high-concentration raw keton, now spilled all across the floor.
I'm going to count from three, and that's your final chance!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Three!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Two!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: One!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: The collapsible military pike shoots forth like lightning, smashing apart at least ten centimeters' worth of concrete wall and tearing through the structure.
But in the following instant...
The sound of an explosion as grand as thunder rolls across the entirety of Caladon.
Harsh firelight follows a mushroom cloud straight into the skies, shining over the abandoned plate, through the Gododdin night, and across the southwest harbors of Victoria.
In the wake of the cabin's explosion, the surrounding ground caves in entirely, crashing down to the city plate's structural layer.
And that layer being in deep disrepair, it continues its collapse, dropping down and down, letting out an unending rumbling roar.
Where the cabin once stood now resembles a direct strike from a high-speed battleship bombardment. Only a massive pit filled with thick smoke remains to tell the tale.
The suspects, the evidence, and the truth are all blown away into the black smog along with the abandoned building, trailing high and away with the wind.
Wh... What happened?!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Blown head over heels by the shockwave, the Victorian Mounted Officer now stares in bewilderment at the entire sight before her. Nothing that just happened has processed for her yet.
November 28th, 1097.
Nighttime in Caladon City finds itself exceptionally lively.
